The effect of <e10> dofetilide </e10> on the steady-state pharmacokinetics of <e20> digoxin </e20> was evaluated in a randomized, double-blind study.

Although clinical evidence to date has not demonstrated renal precipitation of oxypurines in patients either on <e10> allopurinol </e10> alone or in combination with <e22> uricosuric_agents </e22> , the possibility should be kept in mind.

In clinical trials, <e11> FLOLAN </e11> was used with <e20> digoxin </e20> , diuretics , anticoagulants , oral vasodilators , and supplemental oxygen ,In a pharmacokinetic substudy in patients with congestive heart failure receiving furosemide or digoxin in whom therapy with FLOLAN was initiated, apparent oral clearance values for furosemide (n = 23) and digoxin (n = 30) were decreased by 13% and 15%, respectively, on the second day of therapy and had returned to baseline values by day 87.

<e10> Furosemide </e10> may interact with alcohol, antihistamines, anticoagulants, barbiturates, monoamine_oxidase_inhibitors ( MAOIs ), and <e22> tricyclic_antidepressants </e22>.

Drugs Decreasing Heparin Effect: Digitalis, tetracyclines, corticosteroids, <e10> cyclosporine </e10>, nicotine, and <e20> alcohol </e20> may have an additive or potentiating effect on the blood-glucose-lowering effect of heparin.

<e10> Codeine </e10> may interact with alcohol, anticonvulsants (eg, phenytoin, carbamazepine, and valproate ), and other CNS_depressants (eg, barbiturates, tranquilizers, <e20> opioids </e20>, general anesthetics, phenothiazines, and sedatives ).
<e10> Acitretin </e10> may interact with the following medications: acetaminophen, <e20> sulfapyridine </e20>, tamoxifen, theophylline, vitamin_A, and bromocriptine.
<e10> Flurbiprofen </e10> may interact with some <e22> aspirin </e22> preparations.

<e10> Imipramine </e10> may interact with the following medications: alcohol, <e22> barbiturates </e22>, anticoagulants, corticosteroids, cyclosporine, dopamine, desipramine, efavirenz, enalapril, oral contraceptives, rifampin, risperidone, theophylline, verapamil, and theophylline_hydro
The concomitant administration of <e10> ketoconazole </e10> and <e20> pentamidine </e20> is therefore not recommended.
